Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Good morning, Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, welcome back, Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Drew. I'm Drew now.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh. Drew. Sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Apology not... accepted. Because it wasn't even necessary in the first place. [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Several weeks ago, Andy Bernard had an incident. [cut to shot of Andy punching a hole in the wall] But after five weeks in Anger Management, I'm back. And I've got a new attitude. And a new name. And... a bunch of new techniques for dealing with the grumpies.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Mornin' Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, Andy. How are you, man?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Good. Drew.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What's that?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Dr-- You can call me Drew.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, I'm not gonna call you that.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Cool. I can't control what you do. I can only control what I do.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Drew. [walks to Dwight] Dwight. How's it goin' man?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes, I have decided to shun Andy Bernard for the next three years. Which I'm looking forward to. It's an Amish technique. It's like slapping someone with silence. I was shunned from the age of four until my sixth birthday... for not saving the excess oil from a can of tuna.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim, could you please inform Andy Bernard that he is being shunned.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Andy, Dwight says welcome back, and he could use a hug.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ok, tell him that's not true.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight says that he actually doesn't know one single fact about bear attacks.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You guys...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ok, no. Jim, tell him that bears can climb faster than they can run. Jim! Tell him!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [half-heartedly] Andy! Nah, that's too far.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Damn you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Today is Safety Training Day. Toby is leading ours upstairs. Yeauck. But, I am giving everyone a little bit of a treat. We are going to listen in on Darryl's presentation to the warehouse. And if I know Darryl, it gonna be zoppity.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Now, this is the forklift. You need-- [Michael rattles it] You need a license to operate this machine. That means the upstairs office workers can't drive it. ... Quiz! Mike.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Should you drive the forklift?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I can, and I have.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: No! No no no no no! I said should you. You should not drive it. You should not drive the forklift, you understand?

Quote.Speaker: Lonny
Quote.Text: You're not allowed to drive the forklift.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: It's not safe, you don't have a license.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Guys, I'm not the only one who's driven the forklift. [points] Pudge has driven the forklift.

Quote.Speaker: Madge
Quote.Text: Madge.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I thought your name was Pudge?

Quote.Speaker: Madge
Quote.Text: No, it's always been Madge.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. Um, her.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Her. Yes, "her" is qualified to work a dangerous machine. You are not. Okay?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah, fine.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Do you understand that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeeesh.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: We do safety training every year, or after an accident. ... We've never made it a full year. This particular time, I was reaching for a supply box on the top shelf, when one office worker, who shall remain nameless, kicked the ladder out from under me and yelled...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [barely keeping his composure] "Hey Darryl, how's it hangin'?!" [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: And I fell and busted my ankle. I'm legitimately scared for my workers.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: The baler can flatten a car engine. It can cut off your arm and crush your entire body without skipping a beat.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It's on!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: How many people a year do you think get their arms cut off in a baler?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Bail'er? I hardly know her.

Quote.Speaker: Lonny
Quote.Text: Dammit, Michael. Pay attention, man.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Anybody wanna take a guess? Anybody?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Five bucks says it's over 50.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You really wanna bet?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Anybody?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Ever since March Madness ended, I am so bored.

Quote.Speaker: Guy
Quote.Text: How many?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok, you're on.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Ten people, Michael. Ten people. Would you like to be one of them?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [mouths] Damn...

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [in background] You have to be alert, and calm. And always careful...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, don't worry about it. We'll just got double or nothin'.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: On what?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't know, we'll figure somethin' out.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Nice.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What are you guys talkin' about?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: These are very dangerous machines down here, and the upstairs workers, Michael, should not go anywhere near them.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, yes. But it wouldn't be the worst thing in the world... if somebody...

Quote.Speaker: Darry
Quote.Text: It would be the worst thing in the world! It would! Very much so.

Quote.Speaker: Lonny
Quote.Text: What the hell is wrong with this man?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's a big red trash compactor!

Quote.Speaker: Lonny
Quote.Text: What are you--

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: It's not a trash compactor! It's a baler!

Quote.Speaker: Lonny
Quote.Text: Don't disrespect the baler!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, okay! I got it. I got it. ... Only on the rarest of occasions...

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: No do not touch it!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...would I go near--

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: There is no occasion for you to go near this stuff, okay?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Toby now has the floor... and he is going to try not to screw this up, like everything else in his life. Let me rephrase that. I believe that you can do safety training and make it sound just as good as Darryl. Here we go!

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Ok, um, one thing that you're gonna want to look out for is carpal tunnel syndrome. It's recommended that you take a ten minute break from typing every hour. For your circulation, you're gonna want to get up out of your chairs and uh, and move around about ten minutes every hour.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, good. Fine. Like stretching and...

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Um, yeah. You're computer screen can be a big strain on your eyes, so uh, it's also recommended that you step away for about... about ten minutes every hour.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow, that is... that time really adds up. That's like... a half an hour, every hour?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Take them at the same time.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok, you know what? You're making it sound kind of lame. So, skip ahead to the really dangerous stuff. Like sometimes computers can explode, can they not?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: No, no. Um, you always want to keep a sweater or cardigan of some sort, in case it gets drafty.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: What about a long sleeve T?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Well, that'll work.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Long johns? A shaw?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: You know, anything that warms you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok, you know what? I think that everybody is going to vomit due to boredom. [to warehouse guys] Sorry, he is very lame. [takes book from Toby] Um, let's see. "Seasonal affective disorder! A depression that includes weight gain, fatigue, irritability, brought on by the low light of winter."

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Thank God we only had a baler to deal with.

Quote.Speaker: Lonny
Quote.Text: Yeah, that dim light is a bitch, ain't it?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok guys, you know what? I didn't-- I didn't interrupt when you were having your presentation.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Actually, you did.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes. Okay, let's do another one. This is a good one. "A particular concern for office workers is a sedimentary life style, which can contribute--"

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Sedentary.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes. "Which can contribute to heart disease." Heart disease kills more people that balers.

Quote.Speaker: Lonny
Quote.Text: That's called having a fat butt, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mmmm, no, no, it's... sedentary...

Quote.Speaker: Lonny
Quote.Text: Yeah, yeah. That's, that's fat butt disease. That's what you suffer from?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Lonny
Quote.Text: Fat butt disease, Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Excuse me, sea monster, you weigh like a thousand pounds.

Quote.Speaker: Lonny
Quote.Text: Yeah? I bet you'd like to swim with this sea monster, wouldn't you?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Ryan?

Quote.Speaker: Lonny
Quote.Text: Dude, tell your girl to shut up.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: What?!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Kelly, you insulted the gentleman. Please apologize.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Are you kidding me?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Alright, we outta here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Darryl, I did not walk out in the middle of yours. So, I--

Quote.Speaker: Lonny
Quote.Text: Yeah, but ours was real, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: That's what I've been trying to tell you, Mike. It's serious down there. We do dangerous stuff, man. This is shenanigans, foolishness, Nerf-ball. You live a sweet, little, Nerf-y life. Sittin' on your biscuit. Never havin' to risk it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. ... What, Nerf isn't cool anymore?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Darryl thinks he is such a man because he works in a warehouse. I worked in a warehouse. Men's Warehouse. I was a greeter. I'd like to see Darryl greet people. Probably make 'em feel like wimps. Not me, I... "Hello, I'm Michael. Welcome to Men's Warehouse. We have a special on khaki pants today." ... This is one example.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [Pam is holding a jar of jellybeans] Ten.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Really, ten? That's your guess? You're a professional accountant.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: There's like ten green ones.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Forty-two.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm gonna say fifty.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Fifty-one.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, don't be that person.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: That is lame.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: It's a strategy!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's called being smart.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh, geeze.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't know how the whole betting thing started, but it's fun.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ten...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Kev's out.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Damn it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: 47, 48, 49! Jim wins!

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: Oooh! [Jim claps]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: That is not fair. He has spent hours up here at reception with you. Hours and hours.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, okay.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No, constantly. Like, for years.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam, depression is as scary as a baler, right?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't understand the question.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Working in an office can lead to depression. Which can lead to suicide. I mean this is really serious stuff.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I-- I-- Nobody commits suicide because they work with a baler, and yet those guys are makin' fun of me, calling me a Nerf, that...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's really hard to demonstrate depression. Their safety training had visuals.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah... you are... ah, so right. They had visual aids. And all we had were the facts. You don't go to the science museum and get handed a pamphlet on electricity. You go to the science museum and you put your hand on a metal ball, your hair sticks up straight... and you know science.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So, you're okay?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Indubitably.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: They use props. They use visual aids, and they just made us look like dopes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Idiots! God, what are we gonna do!?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't know, I don't know. Because you know what our killer is? Depression--

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wolves.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nn-- Depression.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Visual aids.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: A quilt. Depression quilt?

Quote.Speaker: Micheal
Quote.Text: No time to sew a quilt. ... I got it. Give me the number for the Giant Big Box Toy Store.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You may be asking yourself, "What am I doing on a trampoline?" Well, I thought I'd bounce here for a while, relieve some stress, and then move on with my day. Not! Here's the plan. Dwight, is going to gather all of the office workers and all of the warehouse guys, we're going to have another safety seminar. Only this time, where's Michael? Oh my God! He is on the roof! Now I have got their attention. I... tell them, about the cold hard facts of depression. And then I say, "Hey! You ever seen a suicide?" And I jump. And they freak out. And they get to see... the dangers of depression with their own eyes. Nice side note:

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: So then the next movie moves to the top of the queue. So number five becomes number four, number six becomes number five, [Ryan checks his watch]number three becomes number two, etc, etc. And let's just say that I just sent back Love Actually, which was awesome. [Karen lays money down on the desk next to Ryan] And they sent me Uptown Girls, which is also awesome. But guess what, now I want to see love actually again, [Phyllis throws her money down] but it's at the bottom of the que! Oh no, what do I do!? [Creed throws his money down] What I do, is this. I go online, I go click, click, click. And I change the order of the que, so that I can see Love Actually [Pam throws her money down] as soon as I want to. It's so easy, Ryan. Do you really not know how Netflix works? [Jim throws his money down]

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I guess I forgot. [kisses Kelly, gathers up all the money]

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: You're such a ditz.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Ryan, well done. Two minutes, forty-two seconds. Additionally, Pam, you win ten because she said "awesome" 12 times, and Jim, you win five because she mentioned six romantic comedies.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [on the roof] Okay, let's do this thing! I'll go summon the troops!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Maybe we should test it first. Letterman-style. Throw a TV over, or...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We measured it once...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Go buy some watermelons.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Seedless?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just...

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [Creed takes a bite of an apple] Creed is eating an apple. I found a potato.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey Creed.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Hello. [Jim replaces Creed's apple with a potato][Creed takes a bite of the potato]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Here you go. [hands money]

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Nice.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: I don't know this place as well as I thought I did. I'm getting cleaned out.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ready?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Let's do it! Drop that sucker.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [drops watermelon, watermelon bounces off trampoline, onto a car, bursts, car alarm sounds]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: BINGO! WHOA WHOA WHOA! Oh... crap. Deactivate the car alarm. Clean up the mess.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Find out whose car that is. If it's Stanley's, call the offices of James P. Albini, see if he handles hate crimes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Got it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Also, take apart the trampoline, stick it in the baler.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We're not allowed to use the baler.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Have Pa-adge do it, or... the sea monster.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm on it!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm temporarily lifting the shun.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It means nothing. I need you to do something for me.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Anything.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, calm down. I need you to acquire an inflatable house, and/or castle.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You mean a moon bounce.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What do you think? You've got an hour.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm gonna need... I'm gonna need petty cash.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Shunning resumed.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Do you, do you want a drawbridge?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Un-shun. Yeah that sounds good. Re-shun.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh yeah, this is much better. Safer. Excellent decision.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, thank you for seeing that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: When you land, try and land like an eight year-old. These bouncy castles are not designed for adults.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't know if I wanna do this.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Do you wanna do another test? I got plenty of watermelons in my trunk!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. No more. The tests are going terrible. If we keep doing it, we're not gonna want to jump. This is about doing, not thinking.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's right! Doing! Totally doing! It's rock n' roll!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Rock n' roll!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's right! I am not thinking.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [imitating the sound and playing an air guitar] Near near near near near!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes! Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [singing] Michael is awesome! Jumpin' off the roof!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Woo!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [singing] Bouncin' on the bouncy bounce! Show 'em who's boss!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Woo!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [singing] Rip a hole in the suuuuuuun!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am ready to do this! I am ready to make a point! [Dwight continues air guitar]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [out of breath] Guys! Listen up! Michael is up on the roof, and acting strange!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Whoa! What's the situation?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [hesitates] Un-shun. I think he's suffering from depression. Re-shun.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ok, when's the shunning thing gonna end?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Un-shun. Never. Re-shun. I think he wants you all to come out to the parking lot and watch him die!

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Is it nice outside?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's gorgeous. Let's go!

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Do I need my jacket?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No really, it's, it's very nice. Come on!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Will I be too warm in a long sleeve T?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Everybody's gonna be fine in exactly what they're wearing, let's go! Let's go!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [outside] Come on, hurry up you guys!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [on the roof] My life! Oh, my life...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [on megaphone] Michael, what's wrong?!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Everything's wrong. The stress of my modern office, has caused me to go into a depression.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Depression? Isn't that just a fancy word for feeling bummed out?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight, you ignorant slut. Depression is a very serious illness. Over 32 thousand people commit suicide every year! According to a 2004 study!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Is that the last year the data was available?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes! My head is in such pain! And turmoil!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Don't do anything rash!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wait, where are the warehouse guys?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I didn't... [Dwight runs up to the side of the building] I didn't think you needed them for this part.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay... that's...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: you said to just...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's the whole point, dummy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, I'm on it!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Attention blue collar workers!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What are the odds that this is in any way real?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'd say like... 10,000 to 1?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Okay, I'd like ten bucks on those odds.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: If someone gives you 10,000 to 1 on anything, you take it. If John Mellencamp ever wins an Oscar, I am going to be a very rich dude.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael's up on the roof and he's acting strange!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oooooh, my life!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael! What's wrong?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Everything is wrong, Dwight. The stress of my modern office, has made me depressed.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Depressed? Isn't that just a fancy word for feeling bummed out?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight, you ignorant slut.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, you know, the first performance was a little off. But I really think they hit their stride, in the second show. Um, might even bring my parents tomorrow, to the matinee.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And that is why, I am going to jump off this roof!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, excuse me. It's my... favorite part.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: This is just offensive.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: At least we're outside.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [zipping up his pants] Hey, check it out, there's a... there's a castle over there.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh my God, there is a castle.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, there's nothing to see over there, people! There's nothing to see. ...They found the castle, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Damn it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh... God. Oh my God, he's gonna jump.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh. He's going to kill himself, pretending to kill himself.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey uh, Michael. Don't jump on the bouncy castle. You can't do that, because you're going to get horribly, horribly injured.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey Michael! I have a present for you, but you have to come down and get it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What is it?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Come down and... open it and you'll see.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight, find out what the present is.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, uh... I don't see anything. She might be bluffing.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dwight, what are you--

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh... It's uh, a Repliee Q1 Expo female robot, they're only available in Japan.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight, you are such a liar. Pam, really, what is it?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Mike, this is the opposite of safety. You jump, you're gonna serious hurt yourself.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You told me, that I lead a... cushy, wimpy, Nerf life.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah, but I never said you had nothing to live for.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What do I have to live for?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: A lot... of things. Uh, you, uh... What about Jan? Lovely, lovely, lovely Jan, man. It's goin' good, right?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's complicated with Jan. And I don't know where I stand, or what I want. The sex isn't nearly as good as it used to be.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Mike, you're a very brave man. I mean, it takes courage just to be you. To get out of bed every single day, knowing full well, you gotta be you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do you really mean that?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I couldn't do it. I-- I ain't that strong. And I ain't that brave.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm braver than you?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Way braver! You Braveheart, man.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I Braveheart. I am.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Come down, okay?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. Pam, I'm coming down to get my present.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: An office... is as safe as the people in it. And sometimes those people can drive you to do crazy things to show the dangers of the office. That's the danger I found myself in today. I saved a life. My own. Am I a hero? I really can't say. But, yes.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: When people think of Andy, they think of hate and anger. When people think of Drew, they think of baked goods.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh my God, these cookies have no flavor. How is that possible?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: They are the worst. Who's this Drew chick?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Drew isn't a girl... She's Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh no, nobody likes my cookies. I'm so angry, argh I want to hit something. [laughs] Totally kidin' guys.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Little device I learned to diffuse tension, be the first to make fun of yourself, because if they make fun of you before you do... Then you might lose your mind.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [pours the last of the coffee into his mug]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ahhh... Is that the last of it?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I'm sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It's OK. I can't always have what I want, but I can always want what I have.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Well, would you like a cup of no coffee? 'Cause that's what we have.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Is it fresh? [winks]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Are you going to beat me up?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Umm... [draws back arm] No. [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: People don't need to be afraid of me. I can't achieve anger any more, and I have a new car. Toyota Prius, because Andy didn't care about fuel efficiency, but Drew has seen "An Inconvenient Truth". Nearly twice.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [walks around Andy's new car keying it]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK, come on everybody, go time. Pam let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I thought I'd stay and answer the phones.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't worry Pam, you will be answering phones for the rest of your life... Your long lovely life. [whispers to camera] saved it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Here we go.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Field Trip.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Step lively. Single file everybody.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Like we're going to the science museum.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let's single...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Learn by touching.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Single... OK.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I've been told that I'm a tactile learner.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Buddy system, everyone buddy up, find a buddy.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: You should work out Ryan, you would look so hot.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Totally, we should both work out.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Screw you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Kelly, Ryan looks great. You should be thankful that you...

Quote.Speaker: Larry
Quote.Text: Sir, could you please, please focus on Darryl?

Quote.Speaker: Larry
Quote.Text: Try.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Summing up.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sum it up Darryl, sum it up.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We got beat today, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [sighs]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: But it was not a fair fight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No it was not. Remind me again, what was the fight exactly, who was it between, and what was the outcome?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It was the warehouse guys...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Right.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ... Dwight, they embarrassed us...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Argh!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ... because they had a much scarier safety presentation.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ghaaa!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what's funny? Robin Williams. [sighs] When a cat gets stuck in a washing machine. City Slickers. Talking like Borat. You know what's not funny? Safety, or making fun of the person trying to talk about safety. [in Borat voice] Not nice. I must show people how dangerous office can be. High five... Now that's funny.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How do you make depression sexy? How do you... How do you get people interested in depression? That is the conon... the conun... the conumbery

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Those warehouse guys, think that we are all flabby, middle management, nerf balls. Well I'm going to show them that we have nerfs of steel. [winks]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [Michael, Andy, and Dwight are standing around a trampoline] You know guys, I recently learned some pretty cool stuff about the difference between feeling something and... acting on that thing.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Can you tell Andy to focus on the springs? Please.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, Drew.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yes bosses.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know Drew, why don't you go inside. Dwight come here. Where should we put this?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK, ahh, turn around, and do a broad jump for me on go. Ready... Go! One Mississ... OK, you went that far on one Mississ. Ippi would take you to here. This trajectory times the propulsion from your quadriceps would be about three Mississippi, maybe three and a quarter. So one Mississ... correct... ippi, two Mississippi, three Mississippi... e. Right here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK, good. Thank you. Wanna take our time, do this right.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [phone rings] Hello? Hi Bob Vance. [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: That's three times in ten minutes.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Where's my five dollars?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You are my little teddy bear. I wantcha.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I always knew my co-workers were annoying. I never realized I could profit from it. Go ahead Bob Vance, call Phyllis, all day.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [Michael is up on the roof of the building] Michael, go ahead, we're listening.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm going to wait. I don't want to say this twice, it's too painful and I'm too depressed.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [talking through bullhorn] Michael, you can not fly, you can not, I've seen this too many times.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Give me that thing, I want to try.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, you know what we should probably preserve the batteries.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I was just going to say that [yells toward Michael] you have a cute butt. Oh my God I did not just say that, did I just say that? Oh my God I'm so adorable.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I know the timings bad, but I hate to be a nudge, but there's stuff that he has to sign that needs to be mailed by four.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK, if he's not down by four, I'll get the papers up to him.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: OK, it's three forty eight.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK, Ryan you know what? You can do this.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Oh, no, I have no training in this sort of thing.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Don't play dumb, you know damn well what we talking about.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Come on. He'll listen to you.

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: Come on Ryan.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Let's do it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Come on pretty boy.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Michael, you have always taken a great interest in my career.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I will miss you the most Ryan.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Oh, what is your deal man!? Seriously I don't get it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Let me borrow that chief. Michael, you don't have to prove anything to anyone but yourself. So don't jump just to prove anything to us. OK? That said, if you need to prove something to yourself, you should jump.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Up to you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No no no!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: If you do jump, I want you to reach for the sky.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK. careful, thanks. [takes bullhorn from Andy]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Grab a comet and kiss the moon! Kiss it!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: See this is why you always take ten thousand to one. You never know.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You own a convertible. Come on man that's, that's hot. Women love that stuff right?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's only leased, and it's got rust damage, he'll never get his deposit back.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Coal miners, crab fishermen, Dog the bounty hunter, all dangerous jobs. But also upper middle management. [takes deep breath] Wow! I could have fallen off a roof today... And you don't worry about falling off a roof when you work on a crab boat... And there are no roofs in coal mines.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [in parking lot] Goodnight Stanley. [sees his car is keyed, just nods his head]
